intro: Aikinia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. These plants are characterized by their bell-shaped flowers, which are typically yellow or orange in color. Aikinia species are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in temperate climates. They are often found in woodland or rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to their ecological significance.
